meanings.definition: To deceive or outsmart someone through cunning or trickery.
meanings.sent1: She outwiled her friend by pretending to be sick and avoiding the boring task.
meanings.sent2: The sly fox outwiled the hunter by leading him on a false trail.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat outwiled the dog by hiding in a box and surprising him.
meanings.sent4: The clever magician outwiled the audience with his amazing disappearing act.
meanings.sent5: The cunning detective outwiled the criminal by setting up a clever trap.

meanings.definition: To surpass or outdo in wiliness or cleverness.
meanings.sent1: The young inventor outwiled his competitors by creating a revolutionary new gadget.
meanings.sent2: The wise owl outwiled all the other birds in the forest with its exceptional hunting skills.
meanings.sent3: The crafty squirrel outwiled the other animals by finding the best hiding spot for its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The ambitious student outwiled his classmates by scoring the highest on the challenging test.
meanings.sent5: The talented artist outwiled the critics with his unique and innovative paintings.
